page.title: 07SIR JOHN MOORE BARRACKS.
page.content: Sir John Moore Barracks is a Light Division Training Depot. 234 sixteen-year old boys come here for one year to learn to be soldiers. After their training they go on to join a Battalion. The boy soldiers learn how to use weapons and how to read maps.They have P.E.,Sports and Drill. They also learn First Aid and signalling. The eagle which now stands at the entrance to Sir John Moore Barracks was taken from Minden Barracks, Cologne, Germany, while the King's Shropshire Light Infantry were there as part of the British Army of the Rhine in 1925. Sir John Moore Barracks has been the 'home' of the Light Infantry since 1881. It will not be used to train boy soldiers after 1986.
